label: 光明皇后
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 57th  . Nara National Museum . 2005
説明文: (701-760) Wife of Emperor Shōmu and Empress of Japan during his reign, and mother of regnant Empress Kōken (later Shōtoku). Born Fujiwara no Asukabe-hime, also Kōmyōshi, daughter of Fujiwara no Fuhito. A devout Buddhist, she was highly influential in the creation of the Great Buddha and the institution of Buddhism as the state religion. She also founded institutions to help the needy such as the Seyakuin clinic. Her donations to the Great Buddha after Shōmu's death form the core of the Shōsō-in collection. [聖武天皇、孝謙天皇、称徳天皇、藤原安宿媛、光明子、藤原不比等、施薬院、正倉院]
